title: The inside story of England's haka response
text:
England set the tone for their semi-final win prior to kick-off, opting for an unusual response to the New Zealand haka, and facing it down in a V-sign instead of simply standing before their opponents.

Gavin Mairs takes a look at who was responsible for the idea and the thinking behind it.

The idea

Many teams have attempted a defiant response to New Zealand's haka - from France marching towards the All Blacks in an arrow-head formation at the 2011 World Cup, to Wales standing shoulder-to-shoulder and refusing to move long after it was complete in 2008.
